Package com.jimmyselectronics.nightingale

Class Keyboard

java.lang.Object
com.jimmyselectronics.AbstractDevice<KeyboardListener>
com.jimmyselectronics.nightingale.Keyboard
public class Keyboard extends AbstractDevice<KeyboardListener>
Represents a physical keyboard. The individual keys have labels but no physical location.
Author:
Jimmy's Electronics LLP

  • Field Details

    • WINDOWS_QWERTY

      public static final List<String> WINDOWS_QWERTY
      This is an unmodifiable map, usable as a configuration for the keyboard. It is based on the keyboard I am using to write this.

  • Constructor Details

    • Keyboard

      public Keyboard(List<String> keys)
      Constructs a keyboard with the indicated set of keys. The set of keys is not modifiable once constructed. The labels must be unique.
      Parameters:
      keys - A map from key labels to key objects.

  • Method Details

    • getKey

      public Key getKey(String label)
      Obtains the key with the indicated label on this keyboard. Does not require power.
      Parameters:
      label - The label of the key of interest.
      Returns:
      The key corresponding to the indicated label, or null if nonesuch exists.

    • keys

      public Map<String,Key> keys()
      Obtains all the keys on the keyboard, indexed by their labels. Does not require power.
      Returns:
      A map from key labels to key objects.

    • turnOn

      public void turnOn()
      Description copied from class: AbstractDevice
      Attempts to turn on the power to this device. If the device is already turned on or if it is disconnected from the power grid, this method does nothing.
      Overrides:
      turnOn in class AbstractDevice<KeyboardListener>

    • turnOff

      public void turnOff()
      Description copied from class: AbstractDevice
      Attempts to turn off the power to this device. If the device is already turned off or if it is disconnected from the power grid, this method does nothing.
      Overrides:
      turnOff in class AbstractDevice<KeyboardListener>

    • plugIn

      public void plugIn()
      Description copied from class: AbstractDevice
      Connects this device to the electrical power grid, leaving the power turned off. If the device is already plugged in or if its power is already turned on, this method does nothing.
      Overrides:
      plugIn in class AbstractDevice<KeyboardListener>

    • unplug

      public void unplug()
      Description copied from class: AbstractDevice
      Disconnects this device from the electrical power grid. If the device is already disconnected, this method does nothing.
      Overrides:
      unplug in class AbstractDevice<KeyboardListener>

    • disable

      public void disable()
      Disables the keyboard as well as its individual keys. Attempts to enable individual keys on a disabled keyboard (or vice versa) are blocked to maintain the invariant that the enabled/disabled state of the keyboard will always be the same as those of its keys. Requires power.
      Overrides:
      disable in class AbstractDevice<KeyboardListener>

    • enable

      public void enable()
      Enables the keyboard as well as its individual keys. Attempts to disable individual keys on an enabled keyboard (or vice versa) are blocked to maintain the invariant that the enabled/disabled state of the keyboard will always be the same as those of its keys. Requires power.
      Overrides:
      enable in class AbstractDevice<KeyboardListener>
